course_title: Topics: Environmental Studies: Spatial Data & Society
class_notes:
Pre-requisite: ENVS 250
"Spatial Data & Society" is an interdisciplinary course designed to explore the transformative role of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and spatial data in understanding and addressing contemporary societal challenges. Through a combination of theoretical insights and practical skills, this course delves into the myriad ways spatial data is applied across various domains such as public health, environmental sciences, urban planning, and more. Students will learn how to collect, manage, analyze, and interpret spatial data to inform decision-making processes, policy development, and strategic planning.
course_description: Variable topics that are offered as irregular courses. Past course topics have included: Finding Place: Technology, Stories, and the Environment; Introduction to Botany; Environment, Health, and Development; Conservation and Development; Booms and Busts in Resources of Georgia; and Paleoecology.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - W502
